title: PLANT IT
subtitle: If you want to lean more into vegetarian eating, these simple veggie-based scrambles, pasta dishes, and a gooey grilled cheese are tasty ways to do it.

components.text: 5-INGREDIENT RECIPES
Plant It
If you want to lean more into vegetarian eating, these simple veggie-based scrambles, pasta dishes, and a gooey grilled cheese are tasty ways to do it.
Pesto-Polenta Lasagna

HANDS-ON 15 MIN TOTAL 1 HR, 40 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY FIFFEN
304 REVIEWS

components.html:
2(16-oz.) refrigerated pkg. polenta, cut into ¼-inch slices
1(24-oz.) jar marinara sauce (2⅔ cups)
1(6.3-oz.) jar pesto (about ¾ cup)
1cup shredded mozzarella cheese (4 oz.)
¼cup toasted pine nuts

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat broiler. Line 2 baking sheets with foil and coat with cooking spray.

<lede>2.</lede> Arrange polenta slices in a single layer on prepared baking sheets, then spray with cooking spray. Broil, 1 sheet at a time, 4 to 5 inches from heat, until lightly browned, about 4 minutes per side.

<lede>3.</lede> Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 5x9-inch loaf pan or dish and line with a single layer of polenta slices. Spread on ⅔ cup marinara and 3 Tbsp. pesto. Repeat layers 3 times, ending with pesto.

<lede>4.</lede> Bake until heated through, about 45 minutes. Top with mozzarella and pine nuts; bake until cheese melts, about 5 minutes more. (Lasagna can be assembled and chilled, covered, several hours before baking. Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes before baking.)
armagazine.com/pesto-polenta-lasagna
VEGETARIAN | GLUTEN-FREE
PER 2¼<small>x</small>5-INCH SERVING: 542 CAL; 27G FAT (5G SAT); 15G PRO; 60G CARB (7G FIBER, 13G SUGARS); 1,727MG SODIUM

“This gets five stars for such a creative use of polenta—and for tasting great. Instead of pine nuts, I used some chopped walnuts.”
– KIMMY SUE RUBY LOU
Cheesy Spinach Ramen Frittata

HANDS-ON 20 MIN TOTAL 55 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY KEMPSTR
6 REVIEWS
Double up on the cheesy flavor by topping the frittata with shredded Parmesan.

components.html:
2Tbsp. olive oil
1⅔cups chopped green onion
2(5-oz.) pkg. fresh baby spinach
3Tbsp. water
2(3-oz.) pkg. ramen noodle soup (flavor packet discarded)
7large eggs
¾cup garlic and herbs spreadable cheese (such as Alouette; about 5 oz.)
¼tsp. salt

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 375°F.

<lede>2.</lede> Heat oil in a 10-inch ovenproof skillet (with lid) over medium heat. Cook green onion, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 2 minutes. Add 1 pkg. spinach and 2 Tbsp. water; cook, covered, until wilted, about 1 minute. Stir spinach with tongs, then add remaining pkg. spinach and remaining 1 Tbsp. water. Cook, covered, stirring once or twice, until tender, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.

<lede>3.</lede> Meanwhile, bring a saucepan of salted water to a boil. Break each ramen noodle block into 4 pieces; cook, stirring occasionally, until just tender, about 3 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. Toss noodles with spinach mixture in skillet and spread mixture over bottom of pan.
<lede>4.</lede> Blend eggs, spreadable cheese, and salt in a blender until smooth. Pour egg mixture evenly over spinach mixture. Stir gently with a fork to allow egg mixture to flow underneath.
<lede>5.</lede> Transfer skillet to oven. Bake until puffed slightly and a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 35 minutes. Cut into 8 wedges.
armagazine.com/cheesy-spinach-ramen-frittata
HIDDEN GEM | VEGETARIAN
PER SERVING (2 SLICES): 544 CAL; 36G FAT (15G SAT); 21G PRO; 35G CARB (3G FIBER, 2G SUGARS); 711MG SODIUM

“We ate ours with salsa and loved it. Next time, I am going to add more of the cheese spread and maybe a little cheddar.”
– PAULA
For Less Mess
Break up dried noodles inside the package or over a bowl.
Easy Gorgonzola Tofu Scramble

HANDS-ON 20 MIN TOTAL 20 MIN SERVES 2
SUBMITTED BY SC_COOK25
18 REVIEWS

components.html:
2Tbsp. olive oil
½(12- to 14-oz.) pkg. extra-firm tofu, drained and cut into ½-inch cubes
⅓cup finely chopped red onion
¾cup sliced fresh white button mushrooms
1½cups packed fresh spinach
¼cup crumbled Gorgonzola cheese (2 oz.)

components.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook tofu and onion, stirring occasionally, until onion is tender and tofu starts to brown, about 6 minutes. Add mushrooms; cook until tofu is browned and mushrooms are tender, 3 to 5 minutes more. Add spinach and cheese; cook, stirring, until spinach wilts and cheese melts, 30 to 60 seconds.
armagazine.com/easy-gorgonzola-tofu-scramble
HEALTHY | QUICK | GLUTEN-FREE
PER 1-CUP SERVING: 288 CAL; 23G FAT (6G SAT); 15G PRO; 8G CARB (4G FIBER, 2G SUGARS); 296MG SODIUM

“Really simple, really good. I didn’t have Gorgonzola, so we added some crumbled blue cheese to it at the end.”
– ECOASTGIRL
Make It Vegan
Skip the Gorgonzola and stir in a few tablespoons of vegan Parmesan-style cheese alternative.
Balsamic Ravioli

HANDS-ON 25 MIN TOTAL 25 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY VIJMS2
14 REVIEWS
Add extra color to this ravioli by sprinkling on some chopped fresh parsley with the walnuts and Parmesan.

components.html:
1(22-oz.) pkg. frozen cheese-filled ravioli
½cup walnut pieces
¼cup butter
¼cup balsamic glaze
¼cup grated Parmesan cheese (2 oz.)

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Cook ravioli according to package directions. Drain, then arrange in a single layer on a foil-lined baking sheet.
<lede>2.</lede> Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add walnuts; cook, stirring, until browned and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board. Chop when cooled.

<lede>3.</lede> Add 2 Tbsp. butter to skillet; cook over medium heat until slightly browned, 1 to 2 minutes. Add half the ravioli to skillet in a single layer; cook until browned, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate; repeat with remaining butter and ravioli. Drizzle with balsamic glaze, then sprinkle with toasted walnuts and Parmesan.
armagazine.com/balsamic-ravioli
HIDDEN GEM | QUICK | VEGETARIAN
PER 1¼-CUP SERVING: 535 CAL; 26G FAT (11G SAT); 16G PRO; 61G CARB (3G FIBER, 8G SUGARS); 572MG SODIUM

“I used both cheese and sausage ravioli and added pecans sautéed in butter. Delicious!”
– PAULA

“I would add more butter and balsamic. I used cheese ravioli, which is mild-flavored, so you really do need more to coat every piece of ravioli.”
– LUTZFLCAT
Tomato and Garlic Pasta

HANDS-ON 10 MIN TOTAL 15 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY ALMA-LOU
268 REVIEWS
Top each serving with shredded pecorino or Parmesan cheese. Give it a spicy kick with crushed red pepper or cracked black pepper.

components.html:
8oz. angel hair pasta
4Tbsp. olive oil
4cloves garlic, crushed
1Tbsp. tomato paste
2(14.5-oz.) cans diced tomatoes, undrained
2tsp. sugar (optional)
½tsp. salt
¼tsp. black pepper
¼cup fresh chopped basil, plus whole leaves for garnish

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Cook pasta in a pot according to package directions until al dente. Drain.

<lede>2.</lede> Meanwhile, heat 2 Tbsp. oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic; cook until softened and fragrant but not brown, about 30 seconds. Stir in tomato paste, diced tomatoes, sugar (if using), salt, and pepper. Reduce heat to medium; cook, stirring, about 2 minutes. Stir in chopped basil.
<lede>3.</lede> Return pasta to pot and toss with remaining 2 Tbsp. oil; add to skillet with sauce. Cook, stirring, about 1 minute. Top with whole basil leaves.
armagazine.com/tomato-garlic-pasta
QUICK | VEGETARIAN
PER 1½-CUP SERVING: 410 CAL; 16G FAT (3G SAT); 11G PRO; 57G CARB (6G FIBER, 8G SUGARS); 944MG SODIUM

“I added mushrooms and onions. And mmm mmm mmm!”
– MELIFLOR
Pesto Grilled Cheese Sandwich

HANDS-ON 15 MIN TOTAL 15 MIN MAKES 1 SANDWICH
SUBMITTED BY RASSA2
358 REVIEWS

components.html:
1Tbsp. butter, softened
2slices bread
1Tbsp. basil pesto
2slices provolone and/or American cheese
2slices tomato

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Heat a skillet over medium heat. Spread butter on 1 side of both bread slices.
<lede>2.</lede> Spread 1½ tsp. pesto on unbuttered side of 1 slice; transfer, buttered side down, to skillet. Top with 1 cheese slice, tomato, and remaining cheese.

<lede>3.</lede> Spread remaining 1½ tsp. pesto on unbuttered side of second bread slice; transfer, pesto side down, to sandwich in skillet. Cook until golden, 3 to 4 minutes per side. (Reduce heat if needed to prevent overbrowning).
armagazine.com/pesto-grilled-cheese-sandwich
QUICK | VEGETARIAN
PER 1-SANDWICH SERVING: 503 CAL; 37G FAT (20G SAT); 20G PRO; 24G CARB (2G FIBER, 2G SUGARS); 1,108MG SODIUM

“I just got done eating this, and YUM. I did everything as is, except I added two extra slices of cheese.”
– JULES
Easy Vegan Pasta With Kale and Chickpeas

HANDS-ON 10 MIN TOTAL 25 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY RITA
4 REVIEWS

components.html:
1(16-oz.) pkg. spaghetti
¼cup olive oil
5cloves garlic, minced
1(12-oz.) bunch kale, stemmed and chopped (8 cups)
2Tbsp. nutritional yeast (see tip, below)
1(15-oz.) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained
Salt and crushed red pepper, to taste

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain, reserving 1<lede>½</lede> cups pasta cooking water.
<lede>2.</lede> Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add kale; cook, stirring constantly, until tender, 3 to 5 minutes.

<lede>3.</lede> Add spaghetti and yeast; toss to combine. Add enough of the reserved pasta water to create a thick sauce. Stir well. Add chickpeas and heat through, about 2 minutes. Season to taste with salt and crushed red pepper.
armagazine.com/vegan-pasta-with-kale-and-chickpeas
HIDDEN GEM | QUICK | VEGAN
PER 2-CUP SERVING: 679 CAL; 19G FAT (3G SAT); 24G PRO; 106G CARB (13G FIBER, 7G SUGARS); 312MG SODIUM
What Exactly Is Nutritional Yeast?

This inactivated yeast, sold as flakes or powder, has a nutty, cheese-like flavor. Sprinkle it on garlic toast, popcorn, and pasta as a stand-in for Parmesan. Look for it in the health food section of larger supermarkets or at natural food stores. It’s often near the specialty flours or protein powders.
